Class ResourceManager

java.lang.Object
webfx.devs.ResourceManager
public class ResourceManager extends Object
A utility class that is used to retrieve and manipulate resources.

Also performs operations on the External Temp File. The External Temp File is the html file where html content are rendered to. The default location is webfx-external\current.html in the user home directory, but this can be altered using setTempFileURI().

  • Field Summary

    clazz
    The class within a package that contains all resources

    • getRenderedPageUri

      public static URI getRenderedPageUri()
      Returns the URI of the HTML file where rendered pages are written. Creates it if it doesn't exist.

      The file and its directory are saved to the user's home directory

      The default directory is "webfx-external" and filename is "current.html".

      Use setTempFileURI() to modify the default directory and filename

      Returns:
      The java.net.URI of the html file

    • setRenderedPageUri

      public static URI setRenderedPageUri(String directoryName, String filename)
      Returns a writable URI inside a given directory. The file and its directory are saved to the user's home directory

      This is the function that is used to create the html file where rendered pages are written.

      Leaving a paramter null results in the use of the already existing directory and file names, where the default directoryName is "webfx-external" and the default filename is "current.html"

      Parameters:
      directoryName - Name of the subdirectory (e.g., "temp", "rendered", etc.)
      filename - Name of the file (e.g., "current.html")
      Returns:
      The URI to a file inside the given directory, or null if an error occurs

      Reads the contents within a template

      Template must be in resources/template/

      Parameters:
      filename - , The name of the template
      Returns:
      String of the file's contents

      Returns:
      String of the file's contents

    • readResource

      public static String readResource(String filename)
      Reads the contents within a file in the resources directory

      If it's not in the root of resources, must specify the path in resources e.g. /styles/style.css

      Extension must be included in filename e.g. .html, .css

      Parameters:
      filename - , The name of the file
      Returns:
      String of the file's contents

    • evaluateClazz

      public static Class<?> evaluateClazz()
      Attempts to evaluate and return the class that initiated the application by invoking a method named start().

      This method inspects the current thread's stack trace to find a class with a void start() method. This can be useful for context-aware operations during application startup.

      The class can also be manually set. e.g. ResourceManager.clazz = SomeClass.class

      Returns:
      the Class<?> object representing the class that called the start() method, or null if it could not be determined
